intro: Ligusticum scothicum subsp. hultenii, commonly known as Hulten's lovage, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Scandinavia and northern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and pinnately divided, with a strong, spicy aroma. The small white flowers appear in umbrella-like clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
